definition: lit. body made of wood, heart made of stone (idiom)/fig. heartless
surname Mu
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
surname Shi
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He has cardiovascular system of stone.

definition: to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
see 磨杵成針|磨杵成针[mo2 chu3 cheng2 zhen1]
lit. fight tigers with one's bare hands and wade across raging rivers (idiom)/fig. to display foolhardy courage
see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/short attention span
to stick to sth without change (idiom); to persevere
poor but ambitious (idiom); hard-pressed but determined/the worse one's position, the harder one must fight back
to die without regret (idiom, from Analects)
a thousand tries leads to one success (idiom, humble expr.); Even without any notable ability on my part, I may still get it right sometimes by good luck.
lit. light as a goose feather, heavy as Mt Tai (idiom)/fig. of no consequence to one person, a matter of life or death to another
not to submit to force
see 驚弓之鳥|惊弓之鸟[jing1 gong1 zhi1 niao3]
to bide one's time, waiting for an opportunity to stage a comeback in public life (idiom)
lit. the heart of a sheep in the skin of a tiger (idiom)/fig. impressive in appearance but lacking in substance/braggart
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
bear hardship with equanimity/regard wrongdoing with equanimity
